info.title: Azure OpenAI
info.description: Azure OpenAI APIs for completions and search

post.summary: Creates a completion for the provided prompt, parameters and chosen model.
post.description: Creates a completion for the provided prompt, parameters and chosen model.

schema.description: Deployment id of the model which was deployed.

oneOf.description: Array size minimum of 1 and maximum of 2048

prompt.description:
The prompt(s) to generate completions for, encoded as a string or array of strings.
Note that <|endoftext|> is the document separator that the model sees during training, so if a prompt is not specified the model will generate as if from the beginning of a new document. Maximum allowed size of string list is 2048.

max_tokens.description: The token count of your prompt plus max_tokens cannot exceed the model's context length. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 4096). Has minimum of 0.

temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use. Higher values means the model will take more risks. Try 0.9 for more creative applications, and 0 (argmax sampling) for ones with a well-defined answer.
We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

logit_bias.description: Defaults to null. Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. Accepts a json object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the GPT tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. You can use this tokenizer tool (which works for both GPT-2 and GPT-3) to convert text to token IDs. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token. As an example, you can pass {"50256" : -100} to prevent the <|endoftext|> token from being generated.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help monitoring and detecting abuse

n.description:
How many completions to generate for each prompt. Minimum of 1 and maximum of 128 allowed.
Note: Because this parameter generates many completions, it can quickly consume your token quota. Use carefully and ensure that you have reasonable settings for max_tokens and stop.

stream.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. If set, tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a data: [DONE] message.

logprobs.description:
Include the log probabilities on the logprobs most likely tokens, as well the chosen tokens. For example, if logprobs is 5, the API will return a list of the 5 most likely tokens. The API will always return the logprob of the sampled token, so there may be up to logprobs+1 elements in the response.
Minimum of 0 and maximum of 5 allowed.

suffix.description: The suffix that comes after a completion of inserted text.

echo.description: Echo back the prompt in addition to the completion

oneOf.description: Array minimum size of 1 and maximum of 4

stop.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens. The returned text will not contain the stop sequence.

presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

best_of.description:
Generates best_of completions server-side and returns the "best" (the one with the highest log probability per token). Results cannot be streamed.
When used with n, best_of controls the number of candidate completions and n specifies how many to return - best_of must be greater than n.
Note: Because this parameter generates many completions, it can quickly consume your token quota. Use carefully and ensure that you have reasonable settings for max_tokens and stop. Has maximum value of 128.

example.prompt:
Negate the following sentence.The price for bubblegum increased on thursday.

 Negated Sentence:

choices.text: The price for bubblegum decreased on thursday.

post.summary: Get a vector representation of a given input that can be easily consumed by machine learning models and algorithms.
post.description: Get a vector representation of a given input that can be easily consumed by machine learning models and algorithms.

parameters.name: deployment-id
parameters.description: The deployment id of the model which was deployed.

input.description:
Input text to get embeddings for, encoded as a string. To get embeddings for multiple inputs in a single request, pass an array of strings. Each input must not exceed 2048 tokens in length.
Unless you are embedding code, we suggest replacing newlines (\n) in your input with a single space, as we have observed inferior results when newlines are present.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help monitoring and detecting abuse.

input_type.description: input type of embedding search to use

encoding_format.description: The format to return the embeddings in. Can be either `float` or `base64`. Defaults to `float`.

dimensions.description: The number of dimensions the resulting output embeddings should have. Only supported in `text-embedding-3` and later models.

schema.description: Deployment id of the model which was deployed.

post.summary: Transcribes and translates input audio into English text.
post.description: Transcribes and translates input audio into English text.

schema.description: Deployment id of the whisper model which was deployed.
Transcribed text in the output format (when response_format was one of text, vtt or srt).

post.summary: Generates audio from the input text.
post.description: Generates audio from the input text.

schema.description: Deployment id of the tts model which was deployed.

post.summary: Generates a batch of images from a text caption on a given DALLE model deployment
post.description: Generates a batch of images from a text caption on a given DALLE model deployment

schema.description: Deployment id of the dalle model which was deployed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and `desc` for descending order.

values.description: Order results in ascending order
Order results in descending order

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

innerErrorCode.description: Error codes for the inner error object.

values.description: The prompt violated one of more content filter rules.

revised_prompt.description: The prompt that was used to generate the image, if there was any revision to the prompt.

values.description: General content or related content in generic or non-harmful contexts.
Harmful content at a low intensity and risk level.
Harmful content at a medium intensity and risk level.
Harmful content at a high intensity and risk level.

contentFilterResultsBase.description: Information about the content filtering results.

contentFilterPromptResults.description: Information about the content filtering category (hate, sexual, violence, self_harm), if it has been detected, as well as the severity level (very_low, low, medium, high-scale that determines the intensity and risk level of harmful content) and if it has been filtered or not. Information about jailbreak content and profanity, if it has been detected, and if it has been filtered or not. And information about customer block list, if it has been filtered and its id.

contentFilterChoiceResults.description: Information about the content filtering category (hate, sexual, violence, self_harm), if it has been detected, as well as the severity level (very_low, low, medium, high-scale that determines the intensity and risk level of harmful content) and if it has been filtered or not. Information about third party text and profanity, if it has been detected, and if it has been filtered or not. And information about customer block list, if it has been filtered and its id.

contentFilterDetailedResults.description: Content filtering results with a detail of content filter ids for the filtered segments.

promptFilterResult.description: Content filtering results for a single prompt in the request.

promptFilterResults.description: Content filtering results for zero or more prompts in the request. In a streaming request, results for different prompts may arrive at different times or in different orders.

dalleContentFilterResults.description: Information about the content filtering results.

dalleFilterResults.description: Information about the content filtering category (hate, sexual, violence, self_harm), if it has been detected, as well as the severity level (very_low, low, medium, high-scale that determines the intensity and risk level of harmful content) and if it has been filtered or not. Information about jailbreak content and profanity, if it has been detected, and if it has been filtered or not. And information about customer block list, if it has been filtered and its id.

temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
We generally recommend altering this or `top_p` but not both.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or `temperature` but not both.

stream.description: If set, partial message deltas will be sent, like in ChatGPT. Tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message.

oneOf.description: Array minimum size of 1 and maximum of 4

stop.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer. By default, the number of tokens the model can return will be (4096 - prompt tokens).

presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.description: Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. Accepts a json object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help Azure OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse.

messages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. [Example Python code](https://github.com/openai/openai-cookbook/blob/main/examples/How_to_format_inputs_to_ChatGPT_models.ipynb).

data_sources.description:
The configuration entries for Azure OpenAI chat extensions that use them.
  This additional specification is only compatible with Azure OpenAI.

n.description: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message.

seed.description: If specified, our system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same `seed` and parameters should return the same result.Determinism is not guaranteed, and you should refer to the `system_fingerprint` response parameter to monitor changes in the backend.

logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the `content` of `message`. This option is currently not available on the `gpt-4-vision-preview` model.

top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 5 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. `logprobs` must be set to `true` if this parameter is used.

response_format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Used to enable JSON mode.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may call. Currently, only functions are supported as a tool. Use this to provide a list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

functions.description: Deprecated in favor of `tools`. A list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

oneOf.description: `none` means the model will not call a function and instead generates a message. `auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling a function.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

oneOf.description: Specifying a particular function via `{"name": "my_function"}` forces the model to call that function.

function_call.description: Deprecated in favor of `tool_choice`. Controls how the model responds to function calls. "none" means the model does not call a function, and responds to the end-user. "auto" means the model can pick between an end-user or calling a function.  Specifying a particular function via `{"name":\ "my_function"}` forces the model to call that function. "none" is the default when no functions are present. "auto" is the default if functions are present.

chatCompletionResponseFormat.description: Setting to `json_object` enables JSON mode. This guarantees that the message the model generates is valid JSON.

values.description: Response format is a plain text string.
Response format is a JSON object.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

description.description: The description of what the function does.

chatCompletionFunctionParameters.description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object. See the [guide](/docs/guides/gpt/function-calling) for examples, and the [JSON Schema reference](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/) for documentation about the format.

chatCompletionRequestMessageRole.description: The role of the messages author.

values.description: The message author role is system.
The message author role is user.
The message author role is assistant.
The message author role is tool.
Deprecated. The message author role is function.

oneOf.description: An array of content parts with a defined type, each can be of type `text` or `image_url` when passing in images. You can pass multiple images by adding multiple `image_url` content parts. Image input is only supported when using the `gpt-4-visual-preview` model.

chatCompletionRequestMessageContentPartT.description: The type of the content part.

values.description: The content part type is text.
The content part type is image_url.

url.description: Either a URL of the image or the base64 encoded image data.

imageDetailLevel.description: Specifies the detail level of the image.

values.description: The image detail level is auto.
The image detail level is low.
The image detail level is high.

tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

azureChatExtensionConfiguration.description:
A representation of configuration data for a single Azure OpenAI chat extension. This will be used by a chat
  completions request that should use Azure OpenAI chat extensions to augment the response behavior.
  The use of this configuration is compatible only with Azure OpenAI.

azureChatExtensionType.description:
A representation of configuration data for a single Azure OpenAI chat extension. This will be used by a chat
  completions request that should use Azure OpenAI chat extensions to augment the response behavior.
  The use of this configuration is compatible only with Azure OpenAI.

values.name: azureSearch
values.description: Represents the use of Azure Search as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

values.name: azureMachineLearningIndex
values.description: Represents the use of Azure Machine Learning index as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

values.name: azureCosmosDB
values.description: Represents the use of Azure Cosmos DB as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

values.name: elasticsearch
values.description: Represents the use of Elasticsearch index as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

values.name: pinecone
values.description: Represents the use of Pinecone index as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

azureSearchChatExtensionConfiguration.description:
A specific representation of configurable options for Azure Search when using it as an Azure OpenAI chat
extension.

top_n_documents.description: The configured top number of documents to feature for the configured query.

in_scope.description: Whether queries should be restricted to use of indexed data.

strictness.description: The configured strictness of the search relevance filtering. The higher of strictness, the higher of the precision but lower recall of the answer.

role_information.description: Give the model instructions about how it should behave and any context it should reference when generating a response. You can describe the assistant's personality and tell it how to format responses. There's a 100 token limit for it, and it counts against the overall token limit.

endpoint.description: The absolute endpoint path for the Azure Search resource to use.

index_name.description: The name of the index to use as available in the referenced Azure Search resource.

semantic_configuration.description: The additional semantic configuration for the query.

azureSearchChatExtensionParameters.description: Parameters for Azure Search when used as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

title_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a title.

url_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a URL.

filepath_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a filepath.

content_fields.description: The names of index fields that should be treated as content.

content_fields_separator.description: The separator pattern that content fields should use.

vector_fields.description: The names of fields that represent vector data.

image_vector_fields.description: The names of fields that represent image vector data.

azureSearchIndexFieldMappingOptions.description: Optional settings to control how fields are processed when using a configured Azure Search resource.

azureSearchQueryType.description: The type of Azure Search retrieval query that should be executed when using it as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

values.name: simple
values.description: Represents the default, simple query parser.

values.name: semantic
values.description: Represents the semantic query parser for advanced semantic modeling.

values.name: vector
values.description: Represents vector search over computed data.

values.name: vectorSimpleHybrid
values.description: Represents a combination of the simple query strategy with vector data.

values.name: vectorSemanticHybrid
values.description: Represents a combination of semantic search and vector data querying.

azureMachineLearningIndexChatExtensionCo.description:
A specific representation of configurable options for Azure Machine Learning vector index when using it as an Azure
OpenAI chat extension.

top_n_documents.description: The configured top number of documents to feature for the configured query.

in_scope.description: Whether queries should be restricted to use of indexed data.

strictness.description: The configured strictness of the search relevance filtering. The higher of strictness, the higher of the precision but lower recall of the answer.

role_information.description: Give the model instructions about how it should behave and any context it should reference when generating a response. You can describe the assistant's personality and tell it how to format responses. There's a 100 token limit for it, and it counts against the overall token limit.

project_resource_id.description: The resource ID of the Azure Machine Learning project.

name.description: The Azure Machine Learning vector index name.

version.description: The version of the Azure Machine Learning vector index.

filter.description: Search filter. Only supported if the Azure Machine Learning vector index is of type AzureSearch.

azureMachineLearningIndexChatExtensionPa.description: Parameters for the Azure Machine Learning vector index chat extension.

azureCosmosDBChatExtensionConfiguration.description:
A specific representation of configurable options for Azure Cosmos DB when using it as an Azure OpenAI chat
extension.

top_n_documents.description: The configured top number of documents to feature for the configured query.

in_scope.description: Whether queries should be restricted to use of indexed data.

strictness.description: The configured strictness of the search relevance filtering. The higher of strictness, the higher of the precision but lower recall of the answer.

role_information.description: Give the model instructions about how it should behave and any context it should reference when generating a response. You can describe the assistant's personality and tell it how to format responses. There's a 100 token limit for it, and it counts against the overall token limit.

database_name.description: The MongoDB vCore database name to use with Azure Cosmos DB.

container_name.description: The name of the Azure Cosmos DB resource container.

index_name.description: The MongoDB vCore index name to use with Azure Cosmos DB.

azureCosmosDBChatExtensionParameters.description:
Parameters to use when configuring Azure OpenAI On Your Data chat extensions when using Azure Cosmos DB for
MongoDB vCore.

title_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a title.

url_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a URL.

filepath_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a filepath.

content_fields.description: The names of index fields that should be treated as content.

content_fields_separator.description: The separator pattern that content fields should use.

vector_fields.description: The names of fields that represent vector data.

azureCosmosDBFieldMappingOptions.description: Optional settings to control how fields are processed when using a configured Azure Cosmos DB resource.

elasticsearchChatExtensionConfiguration.description:
A specific representation of configurable options for Elasticsearch when using it as an Azure OpenAI chat
extension.

top_n_documents.description: The configured top number of documents to feature for the configured query.

in_scope.description: Whether queries should be restricted to use of indexed data.

strictness.description: The configured strictness of the search relevance filtering. The higher of strictness, the higher of the precision but lower recall of the answer.

role_information.description: Give the model instructions about how it should behave and any context it should reference when generating a response. You can describe the assistant's personality and tell it how to format responses. There's a 100 token limit for it, and it counts against the overall token limit.

elasticsearchChatExtensionParameters.description: Parameters to use when configuring Elasticsearch as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

title_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a title.

url_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a URL.

filepath_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a filepath.

content_fields.description: The names of index fields that should be treated as content.

content_fields_separator.description: The separator pattern that content fields should use.

vector_fields.description: The names of fields that represent vector data.

elasticsearchIndexFieldMappingOptions.description: Optional settings to control how fields are processed when using a configured Elasticsearch resource.

elasticsearchQueryType.description: The type of Elasticsearch retrieval query that should be executed when using it as an Azure OpenAI chat extension.

values.name: simple
values.description: Represents the default, simple query parser.

values.name: vector
values.description: Represents vector search over computed data.

pineconeChatExtensionConfiguration.description:
A specific representation of configurable options for Pinecone when using it as an Azure OpenAI chat
extension.

top_n_documents.description: The configured top number of documents to feature for the configured query.

in_scope.description: Whether queries should be restricted to use of indexed data.

strictness.description: The configured strictness of the search relevance filtering. The higher of strictness, the higher of the precision but lower recall of the answer.

role_information.description: Give the model instructions about how it should behave and any context it should reference when generating a response. You can describe the assistant's personality and tell it how to format responses. There's a 100 token limit for it, and it counts against the overall token limit.

index_name.description: The name of the Pinecone database index.

pineconeChatExtensionParameters.description: Parameters for configuring Azure OpenAI Pinecone chat extensions.

title_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a title.

url_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a URL.

filepath_field.description: The name of the index field to use as a filepath.

content_fields.description: The names of index fields that should be treated as content.

content_fields_separator.description: The separator pattern that content fields should use.

pineconeFieldMappingOptions.description: Optional settings to control how fields are processed when using a configured Pinecone resource.

onYourDataAuthenticationOptions.description: The authentication options for Azure OpenAI On Your Data.

onYourDataAuthenticationType.description: The authentication types supported with Azure OpenAI On Your Data.

values.name: apiKey
values.description: Authentication via API key.

values.name: connectionString
values.description: Authentication via connection string.

values.name: keyAndKeyId
values.description: Authentication via key and key ID pair.

values.name: encodedApiKey
values.description: Authentication via encoded API key.

values.name: accessToken
values.description: Authentication via access token.

values.name: systemAssignedManagedIdentity
values.description: Authentication via system-assigned managed identity.

values.name: userAssignedManagedIdentity
values.description: Authentication via user-assigned managed identity.

key.description: The API key to use for authentication.

onYourDataApiKeyAuthenticationOptions.description: The authentication options for Azure OpenAI On Your Data when using an API key.

connection_string.description: The connection string to use for authentication.

onYourDataConnectionStringAuthentication.description: The authentication options for Azure OpenAI On Your Data when using a connection string.

key.description: The Elasticsearch key to use for authentication.

key_id.description: The Elasticsearch key ID to use for authentication.

onYourDataKeyAndKeyIdAuthenticationOptio.description: The authentication options for Azure OpenAI On Your Data when using an Elasticsearch key and key ID pair.

encoded_api_key.description: The Elasticsearch encoded API key to use for authentication.

onYourDataEncodedApiKeyAuthenticationOpt.description: The authentication options for Azure OpenAI On Your Data when using an Elasticsearch encoded API key.

access_token.description: The access token to use for authentication.

onYourDataAccessTokenAuthenticationOptio.description: The authentication options for Azure OpenAI On Your Data when using access token.

onYourDataSystemAssignedManagedIdentityA.description: The authentication options for Azure OpenAI On Your Data when using a system-assigned managed identity.

managed_identity_resource_id.description: The resource ID of the user-assigned managed identity to use for authentication.

onYourDataUserAssignedManagedIdentityAut.description: The authentication options for Azure OpenAI On Your Data when using a user-assigned managed identity.

onYourDataVectorizationSource.description: An abstract representation of a vectorization source for Azure OpenAI On Your Data with vector search.

onYourDataVectorizationSourceType.description:
Represents the available sources Azure OpenAI On Your Data can use to configure vectorization of data for use with
vector search.

values.name: endpoint
values.description: Represents vectorization performed by public service calls to an Azure OpenAI embedding model.

values.name: deploymentName
values.description:
Represents an Ada model deployment name to use. This model deployment must be in the same Azure OpenAI resource, but
On Your Data will use this model deployment via an internal call rather than a public one, which enables vector
search even in private networks.

values.name: modelId
values.description:
Represents a specific embedding model ID as defined in the search service.
Currently only supported by Elasticsearch.

endpoint.description: Specifies the resource endpoint URL from which embeddings should be retrieved. It should be in the format of https://YOUR_RESOURCE_NAME.openai.azure.com/openai/deployments/YOUR_DEPLOYMENT_NAME/embeddings. The api-version query parameter is not allowed.

onYourDataEndpointVectorizationSource.description:
The details of a a vectorization source, used by Azure OpenAI On Your Data when applying vector search, that is based
on a public Azure OpenAI endpoint call for embeddings.

deployment_name.description: Specifies the name of the model deployment to use for vectorization. This model deployment must be in the same Azure OpenAI resource, but On Your Data will use this model deployment via an internal call rather than a public one, which enables vector search even in private networks.

onYourDataDeploymentNameVectorizationSou.description:
The details of a a vectorization source, used by Azure OpenAI On Your Data when applying vector search, that is based
on an internal embeddings model deployment name in the same Azure OpenAI resource.

model_id.description: Specifies the model ID to use for vectorization. This model ID must be defined in the search service.

onYourDataModelIdVectorizationSource.description:
The details of a a vectorization source, used by Azure OpenAI On Your Data when applying vector search, that is based
on a search service model ID. Currently only supported by Elasticsearch.

citations.description: The data source retrieval result, used to generate the assistant message in the response.

intent.description: The detected intent from the chat history, used to pass to the next turn to carry over the context.

azureChatExtensionsMessageContext.description:
A representation of the additional context information available when Azure OpenAI chat extensions are involved
  in the generation of a corresponding chat completions response. This context information is only populated when
  using an Azure OpenAI request configured to use a matching extension.

filepath.description: The file path of the citation.

chunk_id.description: The chunk ID of the citation.

citation.description: citation information for a chat completions response message.

id.description: The ID of the tool call.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

arguments.description: The arguments to call the function with, as generated by the model in JSON format. Note that the model does not always generate valid JSON, and may hallucinate parameters not defined by your function schema. Validate the arguments in your code before calling your function.

function.description: The function that the model called.

toolCallType.description: The type of the tool call, in this case `function`.

values.description: The tool call type is function.

tool_call_id.description: Tool call that this message is responding to.

role.description: The role of the messages author, in this case `function`.

allOf.description: Deprecated. Message that represents a function.

content.description: A list of message content tokens with log probability information.

chatCompletionChoiceLogProbs.description: Log probability information for the choice.

logprob.description: The log probability of this token.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be `null` if there is no bytes representation for the token.

logprob.description: The log probability of this token.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be `null` if there is no bytes representation for the token.

top_logprobs.description: List of the most likely tokens and their log probability, at this token position. In rare cases, there may be fewer than the number of requested `top_logprobs` returned.

tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

chatCompletionResponseMessage.description: A chat completion message generated by the model.

chatCompletionResponseMessageRole.description: The role of the author of the response message.

oneOf.description: `none` means the model will not call a function and instead generates a message. `auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling a function.

chatCompletionToolChoiceOption.description: Controls which (if any) function is called by the model. `none` means the model will not call a function and instead generates a message. `auto` means the model can pick between generating a message or calling a function. Specifying a particular function via `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}` forces the model to call that function.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

chatCompletionNamedToolChoice.description: Specifies a tool the model should use. Use to force the model to call a specific function.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

arguments.description: The arguments to call the function with, as generated by the model in JSON format. Note that the model does not always generate valid JSON, and may hallucinate parameters not defined by your function schema. Validate the arguments in your code before calling your function.

chatCompletionFunctionCall.description: Deprecated and replaced by `tool_calls`. The name and arguments of a function that should be called, as generated by the model.

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created.

model.description: The model used for the chat completion.

system_fingerprint.description: Can be used in conjunction with the `seed` request parameter to understand when backend changes have been made that might impact determinism.

values.description: The object type is chat completion.

prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt.

completion_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the generated completion.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used in the request (prompt + completion).

completionUsage.description: Usage statistics for the completion request.

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

chatCompletionToolType.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

values.description: The tool type is function.

prompt.description: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should be in English.

temperature.description: The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

audioResponse.description: Translation or transcription response when response_format was json

audioVerboseResponse.description: Translation or transcription response when response_format was verbose_json

audioResponseFormat.title: AudioResponseFormat
audioResponseFormat.description: Defines the format of the output.

file.description: The audio file object to transcribe.

prompt.description: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.

temperature.description: The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

language.description: The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 format will improve accuracy and latency.

timestamp_granularities[].description: The timestamp granularities to populate for this transcription. `response_format` must be set `verbose_json` to use timestamp granularities. Either or both of these options are supported: `word`, or `segment`. Note: There is no additional latency for segment timestamps, but generating word timestamps incurs additional latency.

input.description: The text to synthesize audio for. The maximum length is 4096 characters.

voice.description: The voice to use for speech synthesis.

response_format.description: The format to synthesize the audio in.

speed.description: The speed of the synthesize audio. Select a value from `0.25` to `4.0`. `1.0` is the default.

imageQuality.description: The quality of the image that will be generated.

values.description: Standard quality creates images with standard quality.
values.name: Standard

values.description: HD quality creates images with finer details and greater consistency across the image.
values.name: HD

imagesResponseFormat.description: The format in which the generated images are returned.

values.description: The URL that provides temporary access to download the generated images.
values.name: Url

values.description: The generated images are returned as base64 encoded string.
values.name: Base64Json

imageSize.description: The size of the generated images.

values.description: The desired size of the generated image is 1792x1024 pixels.
values.name: Size1792x1024

values.description: The desired size of the generated image is 1024x1792 pixels.
values.name: Size1024x1792

values.description: The desired size of the generated image is 1024x1024 pixels.
values.name: Size1024x1024

imageStyle.description: The style of the generated images.

values.description: Vivid creates images that are hyper-realistic and dramatic.
values.name: Vivid

values.description: Natural creates images that are more natural and less hyper-realistic.
values.name: Natural

prompt.description: A text description of the desired image(s). The maximum length is 4000 characters.

n.description: The number of images to generate.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help to monitor and detect abuse.

created.description: The unix timestamp when the operation was created.

data.description: The result data of the operation, if successful

revised_prompt.description: The prompt that was used to generate the image, if there was any revision to the prompt.

imageResult.description: The image url or encoded image if successful, and an error otherwise.

spans.description: An array of spans that represent detected objects and its bounding box information.

line.description: A content line object consisting of an adjacent sequence of content elements, such as words and selection marks.

text.description: The text content of the span that represents the detected object.

offset.description: The character offset within the text where the span begins. This offset is defined as the position of the first character of the span, counting from the start of the text as Unicode codepoints.

length.description: The length of the span in characters, measured in Unicode codepoints.

polygon.description: An array of objects representing points in the polygon that encloses the detected object.

span.description: A span object that represents a detected object and its bounding box information.

assistantObject.title: Assistant

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `assistant`.

values.description: The object type, which is always assistant

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the assistant was created.

name.description: The name of the assistant. The maximum length is 256 characters.

description.description: The description of the assistant. The maximum length is 512 characters.

model.description: ID of the model to use. You can use the [List models](/docs/api-reference/models/list) API to see all of your available models, or see our [Model overview](/docs/models/overview) for descriptions of them.

instructions.description: The system instructions that the assistant uses. The maximum length is 32768 characters.

tools.description: A list of tool enabled on the assistant. There can be a maximum of 128 tools per assistant. Tools can be of types `code_interpreter`, `retrieval`, or `function`.

file_ids.description: A list of [file](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs attached to this assistant. There can be a maximum of 20 files attached to the assistant. Files are ordered by their creation date in ascending order.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

assistantObject.description: Represents an `assistant` that can call the model and use tools.

model.description: ID of the model to use. You can use the [List models](/docs/api-reference/models/list) API to see all of your available models, or see our [Model overview](/docs/models/overview) for descriptions of them.

name.description: The name of the assistant. The maximum length is 256 characters.

description.description: The description of the assistant. The maximum length is 512 characters.

instructions.description: The system instructions that the assistant uses. The maximum length is 32768 characters.

tools.description: A list of tool enabled on the assistant. There can be a maximum of 128 tools per assistant. Tools can be of types `code_interpreter`, `retrieval`, or `function`.

file_ids.description: A list of [file](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs attached to this assistant. There can be a maximum of 20 files attached to the assistant. Files are ordered by their creation date in ascending order.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

model.description: ID of the model to use. You can use the [List models](/docs/api-reference/models/list) API to see all of your available models, or see our [Model overview](/docs/models/overview) for descriptions of them.

name.description: The name of the assistant. The maximum length is 256 characters.

description.description: The description of the assistant. The maximum length is 512 characters.

instructions.description: The system instructions that the assistant uses. The maximum length is 32768 characters.

tools.description: A list of tool enabled on the assistant. There can be a maximum of 128 tools per assistant. Tools can be of types `code_interpreter`, `retrieval`, or `function`.

file_ids.description: A list of [File](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs attached to this assistant. There can be a maximum of 20 files attached to the assistant. Files are ordered by their creation date in ascending order. If a file was previously attached to the list but does not show up in the list, it will be deleted from the assistant.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

values.description: The assistant is deleted

type.description: The type of tool being defined: `code_interpreter`

values.description: code_interpreter as type of tool being defined

type.description: The type of tool being defined: `retrieval`

values.description: retrieval as type of tool being defined

type.description: The type of tool being defined: `function`

values.description: retrieval as type of tool being defined

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

runObject.title: A run on a thread

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.run`.

values.description: The run object type which is always thread.run

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run was created.

thread_id.description: The ID of the [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) that was executed on as a part of this run.

assistant_id.description: The ID of the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for execution of this run.

status.description: The status of the run, which can be either `queued`, `in_progress`, `requires_action`, `cancelling`, `cancelled`, `failed`, `completed`, or `expired`.

values.description: The queued state
The in_progress state
The required_action state
The cancelling state
The cancelled state
The failed state
The completed state
The expired state

tool_calls.description: A list of the relevant tool calls.

submit_tool_outputs.description: Details on the tool outputs needed for this run to continue.

required_action.description: Details on the action required to continue the run. Will be `null` if no action is required.

values.description: The server failed to respond to request due to server error
The server failed to respond to request due to rate limit exceeded

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

last_error.description: The last error associated with this run. Will be `null` if there are no errors.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run will expire.

started_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run was started.

cancelled_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run was cancelled.

failed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run failed.

completed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run was completed.

model.description: The model that the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for this run.

instructions.description: The instructions that the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for this run.

tools.description: The list of tools that the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for this run.

file_ids.description: The list of [File](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for this run.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

runObject.description: Represents an execution run on a [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads).

assistant_id.description: The ID of the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) to use to execute this run.

model.description: The ID of the [Model](/docs/api-reference/models) to be used to execute this run. If a value is provided here, it will override the model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated with the assistant will be used.

instructions.description: Override the default system message of the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

tools.description: Override the tools the assistant can use for this run. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call in the `required_action` object within the run object the output is being submitted for.

output.description: The output of the tool call to be submitted to continue the run.

tool_outputs.description: A list of tools for which the outputs are being submitted.

id.description: The ID of the tool call. This ID must be referenced when you submit the tool outputs in using the [Submit tool outputs to run](/docs/api-reference/runs/submitToolOutputs) endpoint.

type.description: The type of tool call the output is required for. For now, this is always `function`.

values.description: The type of tool call the output is required for which is always `function` for now
The server failed to respond to request due to rate limit exceeded

arguments.description: The arguments that the model expects you to pass to the function.

assistant_id.description: The ID of the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) to use to execute this run.

model.description: The ID of the [Model](/docs/api-reference/models) to be used to execute this run. If a value is provided here, it will override the model associated with the assistant. If not, the model associated with the assistant will be used.

instructions.description: Override the default system message of the assistant. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

tools.description: Override the tools the assistant can use for this run. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread`.

values.description: The type of thread object which is always `thread`

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the thread was created.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

messages.description: A list of [messages](/docs/api-reference/messages) to start the thread with.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

values.description: The delete thread response object state which is `thread.deleted`

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.message`.

values.description: The message object type which is `thread.message`

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the message was created.

thread_id.description: The [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) ID that this message belongs to.

role.description: The entity that produced the message. One of `user` or `assistant`.

values.description: Message object role as `user`
Message object role as `assistant`

content.description: The content of the message in array of text and/or images.

assistant_id.description: If applicable, the ID of the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) that authored this message.

run_id.description: If applicable, the ID of the [run](/docs/api-reference/runs) associated with the authoring of this message.

file_ids.description: A list of [file](/docs/api-reference/files) IDs that the assistant should use. Useful for tools like retrieval and code_interpreter that can access files. A maximum of 10 files can be attached to a message.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

role.description: The role of the entity that is creating the message. Currently only `user` is supported.

text.description: The text in the message content that needs to be replaced.

file_id.description: The ID of the file that was generated.

messageContentTextAnnotationsFilePathObj.description: A URL for the file that's generated when the assistant used the `code_interpreter` tool to generate a file.

runStepObject.title: Run steps

id.description: The identifier of the run step, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `assistant.run.step``.

values.description: The object type, which is always `assistant.run.step`

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step was created.

assistant_id.description: The ID of the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) associated with the run step.

thread_id.description: The ID of the [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) that was run.

run_id.description: The ID of the [run](/docs/api-reference/runs) that this run step is a part of.

type.description: The type of run step, which can be either `message_creation` or `tool_calls`.

values.description: The message_creation run step
The tool_calls run step

status.description: The status of the run, which can be either `in_progress`, `cancelled`, `failed`, `completed`, or `expired`.

values.description: The in_progress run status
The cancelled run status
The cancelled run status
The cancelled run status
The cancelled run status

step_details.description: The details of the run step.

values.description: The server_error
The rate_limit_exceeded status

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

last_error.description: The last error associated with this run step. Will be `null` if there are no errors.

expired_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step expired. A step is considered expired if the parent run is expired.

cancelled_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step was cancelled.

failed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step failed.

completed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step completed.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

runStepObject.description: Represents a step in execution of a run.

runStepDetailsMessageCreationObject.title: Message creation

message_id.description: The ID of the message that was created by this run step.

runStepDetailsMessageCreationObject.description: Details of the message creation by the run step.

tool_calls.description: An array of tool calls the run step was involved in. These can be associated with one of three types of tools: `code_interpreter`, `retrieval`, or `function`.

runStepDetailsToolCallsCodeObject.title: Code interpreter tool call

id.description: The ID of the tool call.

type.description: The type of tool call. This is always going to be `code_interpreter` for this type of tool call.

input.description: The input to the Code Interpreter tool call.

outputs.description: The outputs from the Code Interpreter tool call. Code Interpreter can output one or more items, including text (`logs`) or images (`image`). Each of these are represented by a different object type.

code_interpreter.description: The Code Interpreter tool call definition.

runStepDetailsToolCallsCodeObject.description: Details of the Code Interpreter tool call the run step was involved in.

runStepDetailsToolCallsCodeOutputLogsObj.title: Code interpreter log output

logs.description: The text output from the Code Interpreter tool call.

runStepDetailsToolCallsCodeOutputLogsObj.description: Text output from the Code Interpreter tool call as part of a run step.

id.description: The ID of the tool call object.

type.description: The type of tool call. This is always going to be `retrieval` for this type of tool call.

retrieval.description: For now, this is always going to be an empty object.

id.description: The ID of the tool call object.

type.description: The type of tool call. This is always going to be `function` for this type of tool call.

arguments.description: The arguments passed to the function.

output.description: The output of the function. This will be `null` if the outputs have not been [submitted](/docs/api-reference/runs/submitToolOutputs) yet.

function.description: The definition of the function that was called.

assistantFileObject.title: Assistant files

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `assistant.file`.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the assistant file was created.

assistant_id.description: The assistant ID that the file is attached to.

assistantFileObject.description: A list of [Files](/docs/api-reference/files) attached to an `assistant`.

file_id.description: A [File](/docs/api-reference/files) ID (with `purpose="assistants"`) that the assistant should use. Useful for tools like `retrieval` and `code_interpreter` that can access files.

deleteAssistantFileResponse.description: Deletes the association between the assistant and the file, but does not delete the [File](/docs/api-reference/files) object itself.

messageFileObject.title: Message files

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.message.file`.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the message file was created.

message_id.description: The ID of the [message](/docs/api-reference/messages) that the [File](/docs/api-reference/files) is attached to.

messageFileObject.description: A list of files attached to a `message`.
